pullRequest.body:
This PR adds `TopologicalSemiring` and `TopologicalRing` instances on `C(α, β)`, and also gives explicit names to various related instances on `C(α, β)`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [1f50c4fc66](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13882/commits/1f50c4fc6612ba79e68af3a2ddf444a67902d525)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ instRing`
`++ instance {α : Type*} {β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [TopologicalSpace β] [LocallyCompactSpace α]`
`- instRingContinuousMap`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Is it okay if we *don't* explicitly name the instances? Now that we have a reasonable instance name generation algorithm, it would be nice to rely on it. The autogenerated names here are reasonable, even though they are slightly longer.

Sure -- I'm not a big fan of the autogenerated names even with the new algorithm but it's not a big deal. I left the one that's actually referred to by name elsewhere in mathlib though, I don't think we should rely on autogenerated names in that case.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9679858950/job/26706725839)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9679858950/job/26706727035)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(ContinuousMap): add `TopologicalRing` instance
